text: The Kabul ambulance bombing happened on 27 January 2018 near Sidarat Square in Kabul, Afghanistan. At least 103 people were killed and 235 others wounded in the suicide attack. The Taliban were behind the attack. A bomb was hidden in an ambulance and exploded at a second police checkpoint, according to officials. Its blast also destroyed vehicles, shops, and buildings nearby. At least 103 people were killed and 235 others were injured. ==References== Category:2018 disasters in Asia Category:2010s building bombings Category:2010s explosions in Asia Category:2010s in Afghanistan Category:2010s massacres in Asia Ambulance bombing Category:Attacks on buildings and structures in 2018 Category:Building bombings in Asia Category:Car and truck bombings in Asia Category:Disasters in Afghanistan Category:Explosions in 2018 Category:Explosions in Afghanistan Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in Asia Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in the 2010s Category:January 2018 events Category:Mass murder in 2018 Category:Massacres in Afghanistan Category:Suicide bombings in Asia Category:Suicide bombings in the 2010s Category:Suicide car and truck bombings Category:Taliban Category:Terrorist incidents in 2018 Category:Terrorist incidents in Asia in the 2010s
title: Kabul ambulance bombing
